definitions.definition: An older person or an older member, usually a leader, of some community.
definitions.example: We were presented to the village elder.

definitions.definition: One who is older than another.
One who lived at an earlier period; a predecessor.
An officer of a church, sometimes having teaching responsibilities.
A clergyman authorized to administer all the sacraments.
One ordained to the lowest office in the Melchizedek priesthood.
definitions.example: After being a member of the Church for a while, Bill was ordained to the office of elder.

definitions.definition: Male missionary.
definitions.example: The elders are coming over for dinner tonight.

definitions.definition: (often capitalized) Title for a male missionary; title for a general authority.
definitions.example: One of the long-time leaders in the Church is Elder Packer.

definitions.definition: A pagan or Heathen priest or priestess.
To admonish or reprove for improper conduct by the elders of the meeting.
definitions.example: I was eldered for directly responding to someone else's message in meeting for worship.

definitions.definition: Of an object, concept, relationship, etc., having existed for a relatively long period of time.
definitions.example: an old abandoned building;  an old friend

definitions.definition: Having been used and thus no longer new or unused.
definitions.example: I find that an old toothbrush is good to clean the keyboard with.

definitions.definition: Having existed or lived for the specified time.
definitions.example: How old are they? She’s five years old and he's seven. We also have a young teen and a two-year-old child.

definitions.definition: (heading) Of an earlier time.
Tiresome after prolonged repetition.
definitions.example: Your constant pestering is getting old.

definitions.definition: Said of subdued colors, particularly reds, pinks and oranges, as if they had faded over time.
A grammatical intensifier, often used in describing something positive. (Mostly in idioms like good old, big old and little old, any old and some old.)
definitions.example: We're having a good old time. My next car will be a big old SUV.  My wife makes the best little old apple pie in Texas.

definitions.definition: Excessive, abundant.
A small tree, Sambucus nigra, having white flowers in a cluster, and edible purple berries
Any of the other species of the genus Sambucus: small trees, shrubs or herbaceous perennials with red, purple, or white/yellow berries (some of which are poisonous).
